ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Direction of Arrow in Odd Color Box
correct response to the experimental response task
Length of Time Response Key Depressed (ms)

Notes: keyup=Keyboard; mouseup=Mouse (mouseup); pointerup=Mouse (pointerup); timeout=Timed Out; touchend=Touchscreen
e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2, Daily

ElementDescription: Proportion Correct Responses Across All Trials
Mean reaction time for all correct responses
Choice Reaction Time Task: Median reaction time for correct responses
Choice Reaction Time Task: Standard deviation for the reaction time for correct responese
Number Of Times Participant Restarted Test
